website_summaries.verdict: A solid, time-tested set of gloves that have proven popular with people in training.
pros: Additional protection for wrists and hands
Plenty of size and color choices
cons: These fit hands very tightly, which some might find to be an advantage, but they breathe poorly

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are not worth the money. I've had them for a few weeks and padding is already breaking down and stitching coming undone inside the glove. Padding flies out with every punch. Definitely not worth the money. Very disappointed with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: mg

customer_reviews.title: These gloves suck.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy these gloves. I bought these since it was time for a new pair of gloves. I do boxing and kickboxing 3-4 times a week two hours each session. I literally had these gloves one week and the stuffing is falling out of them and the stitching is coming out. I had stuffing all over the inside of my gym bag after my last class with these garbage gloves. I don't know if these are knock-offs because Venum is usually a good brand, but holy crap don't waste your money on these. Luckily I'm returning these today with the return label I was provided by Amazon. The search for gloves continues!
customer_reviews.author: Elite1315

customer_reviews.title: SAVE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: I got these gloves and they came with rips and holes. I called and asked if I could return or replace them and I was told I couldn't. So I decided I would just try and make them work. After hitting the heavy bag for about 20 minutes the pictures show what they look like. I'm not here to tell you how to spend your money but I am here to tell you to save it. These things suck and customer service is even worse.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: seam ripping and stuffing coming out
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in October and these are my second pair, first pair loved, this pair the seam just started ripping and now the stuffing is coming out. I haven't used them enough for that to be happening. I am very disappointed because I did my research and these were voted highly by other consumers. Maybe I got a bad pair but now I need to buy another pair of gloves and I don't want to have this happen again.
customer_reviews.author: capecod

customer_reviews.title: Coming undone already?
customer_reviews.text: They're comfortable with hand wraps on, properly ventilated, good cushioning too, they definitely protect my knuckles. I'm glad I bought these. BUT, the lining inside has started to come undone and i've only been using them for about a month maybe 3 times a week....so it really shouldn't be coming undone yet.
customer_reviews.author: JRodTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great look and durable but tight.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these by suggestions of people when I asked about hand compartment size being the most important thing to me other than durability. I was told these had a lot of space for my giant hands. I purchased them. They look fantastic and feel durable, it allows me to hit heavy and not feel any pain. However my thumb base rubs quite a bit even with wraps on sometimes it feels like it is getting choked. Other than that minor inconvenience these gloves are nice. My boxing coach had some Ringside's that I spar with and they feel much more comfortable for my giant meat slabs.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony D

customer_reviews.title: look good (after a year and a half of not heavy ...
customer_reviews.text: pros: look good (after a year and a half of not heavy use for friendly sparings only) In comparison to Title- heir internals do not rot cons: terrible system that didn't last 6 months on both gloves (had to replace it) they are not tight gloves, so highly not recommended for serious punching PS
customer_reviews.author: yilativs

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed. I spend the extra money on what I ...
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. I spend the extra money on what I thought was a quality pair of gloves and after use during MMA classes 2-3 days a week the inside lining is torn. I had used them for about 4 months before this happened. I retired my cheap pair that I had used for many years and were still in great condition but developed the usual odor. Venum's may look nice on the outside, but they do not hold up like they should.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin C

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp looking, durable, price is great!
customer_reviews.text: For the price, you cant go wrong with these gloves. They have the features of gloves that cost over $100. Durable, comfortable, and as long as you keep them open while they dry, they have yet to smell after about 40-50 heavy bag workouts. I would highly recommend these for the user who wants some solid protection to attack a heavy bag 2-3 times a week for 30 minutes to an hour, they offer more than enough to meet such training demands.
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: These are pretty solid and have good ventilation
customer_reviews.text: My first time buying boxing gloves. Did a little research into what size I should get and as a 5'10" 165lb male I decided to go with 14oz. I'd probably go with 16oz now that I see them but that's my error. These are pretty solid and have good ventilation.
customer_reviews.author: Leonardo Merza

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart in 2 months.
customer_reviews.text: These started out fantastic- good fit, supportive, strong material...or so I thought. I was massively disappointed when I went to hit the heavy bag today and the stuffing for the padding fell out of the knuckles, through a hole in the material inside the glove and gathered in my hand. They're now relatively useless.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Assurance, but they look nice.
customer_reviews.text: I'll revisit this review when I actually get what I ordered. You can clearly see that the bag says Black/Neon Orange, but the item inside is Pink and has a Pink tag on it. I mean, I'm secure enough that I'd be fine wearing pink (I have some pink wraps, even), but now I have to return these and wait several more days (already waited 4 even with Prime), so overall I'm currently disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Bajah

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gloves! Appropriate for sparring.
customer_reviews.text: Saw the reviews about the stitching coming undone so I thought I'd share my experience. Came on time and undamaged, stitching was perfectly fine, and the fit was perfect. Very comfortable and has held up to multiple sparring sessions. Just a side note, if you're investing in good boxing gloves you should know they fit better with hand wraps so don't be surprised if they don't fit right or are uncomfortable with bare hands.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel fletcher

customer_reviews.title: Go for it!
customer_reviews.text: Started MMA 2 months ago. The gloves took about three weeks to completely break in, with three lessons a week plus hard bag hitting. Once they have broken in they were so comfortable. I try to clean it after every day I train, it hasn't smelled thus far. The breathability also helps as drying off the gloves. Gloves came in perfect conditions in original packaging. Great item!
customer_reviews.author: mvdp

customer_reviews.title: Got some other gloves instead that work great.
customer_reviews.text: These gloves were way big on me. I have small hands, they practically went to my elbows. The velcro was so high up that it didn't give wrist support. I probably just got a size or 2 too big. Got some other gloves instead that work great.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Cheap cheap plastic shell
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely HORRIBLE glove that has cheap plastic. As a beginner after a few punches, it already scratched my clean punching bag and I immediately went to an Amazon locker and returned that thing. I was so upset and told VENUM is the Nike equivalent for boxing, but, I was misinformed. This thing is for those people who put boxing gloves on display with good lighting, and invites girls over to show it off and say “hey I box” and she knows he’s weak.
customer_reviews.author: A Big Buyer

customer_reviews.title: A big improvement
customer_reviews.text: I confused these with the Venum Contender 2.0 16 oz gloves, but I do not regret my mistake. These are well made and feel much more comfortable compared the the contender series, though there is nothing wrong with the contender gloves in my opinion. These are just higher quality. The extra padding makes a world of difference, they look nicer, feel nicer and aren't much more expensive. If you have the few extra dollars to spare I would seriously consider getting these over the contender series.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Bell

customer_reviews.title: Great buy If you want something budget friendly & good quality.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a gift for someone so I can't attest to the durability of the glove. However, based off other reviews & my initial unboxing review I'm going to say these are great gloves. The padding was good, the materials seemed good quality & breathable, and wrist support was excellent. At this price, it's hard to find another pair of quality gloves that compete.
customer_reviews.author: ainaustin

customer_reviews.title: Wears easily
customer_reviews.text: So for beginners who do casual light bag work I'm sure these gloves are fine. If you're using them for heavy bag work outs, sparring and other high intensity stuff I wouldn't recommend them. First off they felt big, I ordered 16 oz for an exhibition match I had coming up and decided to test them out. They felt bulkier then my Hyabusa and Sanbul gloves. also after maybe 3 or 4 hits on a heavy bag I noticed a crack/small rip forming. the top layer of the glove seemed to start falling apart. I used Sanbul for nearly 2 years and they never did that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves!
customer_reviews.text: I've never boxed before and I bought these for my beginner boxing class. I bought the 16 ounce because I wear large-sized latex/other gloves and I was worried about the boxing gloves not fitting. I could've gotten a smaller size for sure, but they're only a little roomy. They fit nicely with wraps on however. As a noob, I also appreciate the extra padding the 16 ounce offers.
customer_reviews.author: Ti S.

customer_reviews.title: Okay for the price; The inner liner is the weakest link.
customer_reviews.text: I had these glove for two years. The gloves have a good cushion and the other leather has held up to light bag work and sparring. I bought the white one so I knew before that there will be marks; it's not a problem. The weakest point is the inner liner. It will separate at the thumbs on both gloves. It's doesn't effect the function of the glove. These gloves will last a decent amount of time but the inner liner will separate within the first month of weekly.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.text: I train Muay Thai. I like to wear the heavy bag out and need a lot of support in a glove due to my size. Even throwing bombs on the heavy bag, my hands and wrist feel unscathed after long sessions. I'm impressed. I've tried quite a few different gloves and most end up being decent sparring or mitt work gloves at best. After I wear these out, I'll be buying another. set.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn M.

customer_reviews.title: Cool gloves, Affordable and high quality
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are super flashy and really make you look like a champ!! I loved the gold color. Not too bright or flashy like I was fearing. It has just the right amount of gold in it without looking silly. The breathability can be an issue for some people but I sweat profusely anyway even with breathable gloves. The strap on is easy to adjust and set. Makes the whole process of putting on gloves quick and easy. The padding is not the best on these but it is a great beginner to intermediate glove for a reasonable price. I've used these gloves for a month now and have had no issues with them!!
customer_reviews.author: Peter T

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good Gloves
customer_reviews.text: As most gloves they are hard to break in but that's to be expected. I've only had them for a little while and the seam inside is coming apart but that doesn't bother me because I have wraps on. I take boxing lessons and for a petite woman they work very well. I'll have to get a new pair in the next 6 months but for the price it's worth it. I have tried other brands and they don't compare. A lot of people at my boxing gym wear this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Zoe

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but poorly made.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed that after using only 2-3 times, there’s a hole on the inside thumb area, so every time I pull my hand out, there’s white cotton fuzz stuck to my wraps. I think it may have been poorly made and sold cheaper as I got it on Prime day. Despite that, they are comfy and not too stiff. The hand opening is definitely tighter than my previous gloves and they are a little longer than I was used to but those things were very easy to get used to after a couple uses.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: I like the ventilation and material used
customer_reviews.text: If you are a female and questioning should I get 12 oz or 14 oz go with 14 oz!!! They will be too small and damaging to your fingers I made this mistake. I'm sure if I had the right size that wouldn't be happening. I like the ventilation and material used. Stiching was a little frayed on one end. The all black is sharp I love it! It is good for do bag drills. Don't know if I'd purchase again like I said bigger size may have helped that decision for me.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: As usual, Venum has the coolest-looking gloves on the market
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a friend who's looking into muay thai. I popped them on when they arrived just to check them out, and they feel great! I wear 16oz Elites, for comparison, and I'm sure that if I hit the bag with both I'd feel a difference, especially over time, but they look great and feel great. Good price for some solid starter gloves with some flair. If you're between these and the Contenders, just buy these.
customer_reviews.author: SA7

customer_reviews.title: ... hands work we do in FMA and do a good job protecting both people involved in the training
customer_reviews.text: These gloves work well for the empty hands work we do in FMA and do a good job protecting both people involved in the training. I'm not a boxer so I can't speak for training in boxing, but I haven't had any issues in FMA and we've been using these gloves for a while. Material has been holding up fine and I don't see needing to replace them for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Not same quality as previously purchased gloves
customer_reviews.text: I ordered same Challenger 2.0 Boxing Gloves 2 years ago- significant difference in quality. These are used on heavy bag... the past pair was firm with excellent wrist support and the new gloves are weak and flimsy. In addition, the interior fabric slides on every punch. Very poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: jh25

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: I have had gloves for over a year by different manufactures. The inside seems has already ripped after using them 7 times.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: BEST GLOVES FOR THIS PRICE.
customer_reviews.text: I got the 16 Oz.... These are really good gloves, great looking and excellent material. The wrist band is elastic and goes 1 loop around the wrist which is very important for added stability and protection, the velcro it uses is really high quality and the elastic material seems very good. I have been using these for sparring and (not too much) bag work and they look exaclty like new, nothing like my 3 or for different gloves that always show some wear or little tears after just the first months (I am a heavy power puncher although only 160 pounds). Highly recommended !
customer_reviews.author: Ernesto Eduardo

customer_reviews.title: Not the best choice
customer_reviews.text: I first bought these for the price and reviews on them but once i got them i regretted it right away tge material was fake leather but im sure it saif that but the padding did not cover my hands completely with tge 16 oz gloves specificaly my finger tips were unpadded and worst of all they charged me 7 dollars to return them so with that being said i would never recomend venum gloves to anyone i know at the gym.
customer_reviews.author: Jeana Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves for a year-or-two
customer_reviews.text: The gloves are fine, especially for the price. The thing you have to remember is that the velcro will eventually wear out well before the glove will. Based on prior experience with Venom, it takes about 2 years for the velcro to lose it's stick, and that's using the gloves 2-3 times a week. You can always wrap them with tape afterwards. If somehow the velcro lasted 4-5 years, i'd give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Moondragon Starshadow

customer_reviews.title: don't buy these
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in November 2016 so they are now about 10 months old. I have taken good care of them and don't use them all that roughly or every day. But within the last few months the velcro has gotten very weak such that I'm not going to be able to use them anymore. They look like new, but a glove with weak velcro is worthless. When I contacted venum's manufacturer, I was told that since I bought these through amazon, the poor quality is amazon's responsibility.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah V Locke

customer_reviews.title: These gloves are a knockout!!!
customer_reviews.text: I just recently purchased the Venum Challenger 2.0 boxing gloves! I've used them a few times already and I absolutely enjoy them! I go to the gym and wear them to do some bag work! They feel fantastic. Very comfortable and fit my hands just right. I recommend wearing wraps to give you hands extra protection. The gloves never slips off. The price was very reasonable for these amazing gloves. I got my money's worth on this one! I have the 16 oz. and they don't feel heavy at all. These gloves have a very cool design and lives up to the name. I highly recommend these gloves for beginners, intermediate, and advanced boxers.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Woodson

customer_reviews.title: Best for your $$!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these Gloves because the price of the Titles and Ringsides were about twice this amount. We've been hitting them for about a month now. Heavy Bag & Mitt work & they don't break down & seem very light, despite being 16 oz.
customer_reviews.author: Steven M. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Good glove for the price
customer_reviews.text: Review updates at bottom Pro: Durable build Good wrist protection Snug fit, they feel good when you put them on Price They make a really satisfying "pop" Con: Breathability (disinfect after workout) No padding on palm. Be careful with knees if you're a kickboxer, or buy the Elite series. UPDATE: As others have stated, the padding on these gloves is quite dense and sparring partners may not appreciate it. This can also cause some hand problems if you have a heavy strike. Not sure if this is because of the padding firmness or if they've worn out quickly. Definitely trying the Elite series next. Still recommend these gloves for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: gilmorefan25

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gloves
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves for my husband. I was a little nervous that the size I picked would be too small for him, but they fit him perfectly. He only has good things to say about them! He ripped right through his last pair, so we will see how these hold up. He has had them now for about a month
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Good fit for smaller hands
customer_reviews.text: While these gloves have a snug hand compartment that fits narrower hands, they don't do well for shorter fingers. The cuffs are also quite long, so if you're just slim, but not short, these gloves would probably work well for you. Padding seems only adequate, but not a bad value for the price point.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Wiens

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Gloves, Poor quality on the inside
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Venum gloves. They are beautiful and have a great weight to them. These just like my first pair had the stuffing come out of the hand from my finger. It's annoying and I haven't owned them that long. If you want durability, there are better brands out there. If you want to look amazing as you spar!! These are the bomb!!
customer_reviews.author: Rodney Brown

customer_reviews.title: These gloves are pretty damn big and cumbersome
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves about a year ago and used them 3 times a week roughly for muay thai and boxing. These gloves are pretty damn big and cumbersome. They have held up not too bad, the inside lining has ripped a bit. Next time I am going to go for a more compact 16 oz gl;ove.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Great glove for the price range
customer_reviews.text: 5’2” 125lbs bought a 14oz pair and they were huge. Had to return for a 12oz pair. Can fit with or without wraps comfortably. Took less than ten hours of training time for them to feel broken in and comfy. To fit without wraps go smaller than you’d think or theyll be huge. Gel is protective of your fists. Broke my knuckle on a liver shot that hit they’re elbow tip with my last gloves. Did the same exact thing with this pair and no injury. Recommend to any beginner/intermediate
customer_reviews.author: J-Moe

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed with durability
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 16 oz version of these gloves hoping for a good-quality set of beginner gloves. Unfortunately, that hasn't been the case. They have begun peeling pretty severely (see pic) after using them twice a week for about three months. I wouldn't have purchased these if I'd known this would be the case. I have raised this issue with Venum support, and it seems like I may be able to get a refund or a replacement. I will update this review afterwards with my experience there. Regardless, I recommend buying a different pair of gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Some bang fo yo buck
customer_reviews.text: These are actually my second pair. I had bought a black pair about 2 1/2 years ago but they have become so warn yet so good to me I had bought a new white pair of the same thing. Can’t complain. They do what you want them to and it’s for an affordable price for good quality. I train 3-4 times a month for about 2-4 hours.
customer_reviews.author: IvynSteez

customer_reviews.title: They're good at the wrist
customer_reviews.text: They're good at the wrist, but they're no everlast 14 oz advance gloves. There's less protection at the hands, but overall lighter feel than the everlast. They're good for sparing, heavy bah work not so much. They're good if you wanna go light on the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Good feel and good price
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like these at first use but I compared the to Title gloves and use them far more. They really grew on me and they have more of a springy feel compared to Title gloves. Title gloves are great but definitely felt harder on the hands. Definitely recommend these especially for the price, you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Israel Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Good Gloves
customer_reviews.text: I'm just starting out kickboxing and don't have a ton of experience but a friend who does Muay Thai recommended these. They fit well and look quality. I have a large hands for a woman but these fit me nicely. My hubs also tried them on and they fit him.
customer_reviews.author: D Wommy

customer_reviews.title: each were great but Venum
customer_reviews.text: I've used a few different brands of gloves, Everlast, Title, Grant, Twins and Sevengear, each were great but Venum, it was by FAR the best gloves I've ever used. I use them for pad work, heavy bag training, sparring and real matches in both boxing and Muay Thai. The wrist support without wraps is superior to any other glove and with wraps, nothing beats it. Good tight fight with great knuckle protection. I would recommend these gloves to all levels of fighters.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Not as durable and good as they used to be.
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased these gloves a few years prior which lasted a while and had great use out of them. I just purchased this one 3 months ago and hard ripped on the inside within 6-7 weeks. Although they offered to replace with pictures, I don't know how I can get pics of the inside of the gloves. Also the padding doesn't seem as great as they used to be. As soon as I used these, my knuckles were getting sore within the hour of use. The old ones never gave me issues on my knuckles. I do not recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: scott macvilay

customer_reviews.title: Nice pair of gloves
customer_reviews.text: Lots of padding. Which is never a bad thing only used them one so far.but I think theyll be good. Gonna use them more though.and they look nice lots of the reviews are bad and ppl complaining about this and that I think ma'b they got a pair from a bad batch possibly
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fit well right out of the box and they've held ...
customer_reviews.text: Fit well right out of the box and they've held up so far. I've seen people have issues with the interior getting shredded by their wraps but I use cloth wraps (not the gel glove wraps) and haven't had that problem. It might also have to do with frequency of use since I only do 90 min sessions twice a week.
customer_reviews.author: Perla

customer_reviews.title: Inside stitching is less than adequate
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Venum boxing gloves in the past year. Definitely should last longer than 6 months and I thought after the first pair....that maybe it was me, but after the second pair’s inside lining came unstitched....I realized it wasn’t me. The lining in the inside of the gloves does not hold up and you end up with loose foam pieces all over your hand and on the floor. After reading the 2 week warranty policy on Venum’s website....I think it’s time to research other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Giles

customer_reviews.title: They look nice, but unfortunately are not very durable
customer_reviews.text: They look nice, but unfortunately are not very durable. The inner lining started separating after a few months of use and the stuffing came out. I wasn't even doing bag work, it was mostly drills on pads or partners gloves. Buy something more reputable like Windy or Fairtex.
customer_reviews.author: Ls

customer_reviews.title: Good so far!
customer_reviews.text: I've read a lot of reviews about these gloves...some great..some not so great. I took a chance because I love the wine color, and I heard Venom was a great brand. I go to a kickboxing gym 3 times a week. I do bag rounds and partner sparring. So far, I find NOTHING wrong with these gloves. They have held up for me, but I don't use them as a 'real' boxer. I would recommend them, personally. But let's see if they stand the test of time. lol.
customer_reviews.author: regg

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves
customer_reviews.text: Bag gloves. Seem pretty durable and comfortable. Don't use them every day. No issues on delivery, were in perfect condition. Have another pair of Venum gloves, 16 oz., just as good.
customer_reviews.author: STEVEN HANCOCK

customer_reviews.title: Durable & Look Great
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these gloves on a regular basis for several years since I've bought them & they're still holding up wonderfully. They don't seem to hold odor from hand sweat but that might be because I usually use hand wraps. I like them a lot & definitely recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome synthetic gloves
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for quite a while, and they've stood up well. I do MMA, and these guys have padded some hard hits admirably. Comfortable, and they didn't have as much of that death smell common to synthetic gloves. I'd recommend some glove dogs if you want to keep them around.
customer_reviews.author: Alex V.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Feel great and protects hands great, after a long sparring session and and a good bag workout my hands felt great... they protect far down your wrist too so it prevents possible injury, wish i would have gotten the more expensive ones due to the gloss finish but this is more then enough.
customer_reviews.author: Adriana Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Nice pair of boxing gloves for my 13 year old son
customer_reviews.text: So far these have held up pretty good for my 13 year old sons boxing class. He did mention that after prolonged hitting on the heavy bags his knuckles begin to ache, but nothing that caused him to stop or modify his workout. Look just like the picture, arrived on-time and well packaged. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Keralexis

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Love these gloves for my cardio kickboxing class. They are super comfortable - these are my 2nd pair. I would say after 1 1/2 years the insides wear out but that’s about 5-8 hours of KB classes per week.
customer_reviews.author: ntg

customer_reviews.title: very good gloves - fits well
customer_reviews.text: Really nice comfortable gloves to use when hitting heavy bag....the fit is a bit larger thank i expected and instead of using bare hands in gloves i am using wraps too..gives greater stability
customer_reviews.author: Sharon F.

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent gloves, I was nervous based on some of the reviews but my son loves them. A little bit of stitching has come undone on each glove the first time he used them, but he is extremely hard on his gloves and so far it hasn't spread, and he has had no flaking issues other people have mentioned. Overall great quality
customer_reviews.author: theoneje

customer_reviews.title: Durable, comfortable, perfect fit!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these gloves! I have small hands and these were really a good fit. I have been boxing for 7 months now and they are still like new. I box every week at least 2 times a week at the gym and at home on occasion. I LOVE Venum!
customer_reviews.author: Miranda Provost

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: As being a amateur i use this gloves for 50 min , 4/5 days in a week , protect hand with good wrap , not heavy perfect for heavy bag and sparring as well , i use this gloves for more than 6 months still the same .. i recommande this item
customer_reviews.author: karim makni

customer_reviews.title: Great Gloves...
customer_reviews.text: I am no where near a pro, or even an amateur, however I do hit the gym for at least 6-7 classes a week. The gloves have held up great. When they arrived, they are stiff so be prepared to break them in. However once you break them in they are good to go. Tons of padding, and the Velcro ensures a snug fit. These are NOT real leather gloves and so they have a very strong vinyl type of smell. If that is an absolute deal breaker for you then go out and buy the $100+ gloves. As for me, I will continue to use these.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Montanez

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as an upgrade to my cheap 20$ gloves that had broken down after a few years. I've used them 3 times a week for the last six months and I'm not impressed. The material inside the gloves has ripped and stuffing is coming out. My thumbs are both damaged and sore from the shape of the thumb on the gloves which keeps jamming them when I punch even when I try to pull & tuck them in. My 20$ gloves lasted way longer and protected my hands better & they were only 14 oz gloves! I won't order these again.
customer_reviews.author: Jacksmom45

customer_reviews.title: Good Gloves to start
customer_reviews.text: I got these gloves to start training again. The brand Venum is a really popular, however once I got these gloves I felt the material instantly felt flimsy. Within the first moth the inside of the glove had torn and pieces of the internal padding had begun to fall out everywhere. For what I paid I was hoping they'd last a little bit longer, but other than that its a decent glove.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Velcro is very cheap and stopped holding on tightly in 4 months after purchase. The stiches became loose in 6 months. This pair was used for about 1 year and trashed. One can find far better gloves for an extra 40 dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Venum:: Black Boxing Gloves
customer_reviews.text: I have had these Black-on-Black Venum Boxing Gloves a couple of years. The Black-on-Black color matches my workout clothes extremely which I personally love. My Boxing Gloves are still in great condition since I stored them the way my Boxing Coaches recommended I should.
customer_reviews.author: Patti Juarez

customer_reviews.title: These are worthless!
customer_reviews.text: You can find much better value gloves for the same money (more or less) - these tore the first time i used them (my brother ordered the same ones and experienced the same issue). Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.author: Amir Frucht

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and hug your fists
customer_reviews.text: My husband is loving these new gloves. He says they hug his fists and fit great. This makes it so much easier to work out.
customer_reviews.author: Neda Essa

customer_reviews.title: Good  Gloves
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my 14 year old grandson I got the 14 oz. gloves. They just fit but I also wrap his hands. They work good.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: A year of very light usage and these gloves are ready for the trash.
customer_reviews.text: I have literally used these gloves once a week for about 10-15 minutes - and after less than 1 year the internally stitching has ripped and the stuffing is coming out. Reading other reviews over the last 12 months - I am not alone. I chose these gloves based on the previous reviews but clearly manufacturing quality control has changed in the last year. Find another pair of gloves...
customer_reviews.author: R Griffiths

customer_reviews.title: Look great and feel great
customer_reviews.text: This was my first pair of gloves I ever purchased for myself and after about 2 months of consistent use, I have 0 complaints. They are comfortable, they stay relatively cool and provide great protection and padding. I have yet to find any of the seams or materials falling apart.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Not a great fit. I'm a woman with average sized hands ...
customer_reviews.text: Not a great fit. I'm a woman with average sized hands and I can put my hands all the way in because the thumb part of it is too far away. Not sure how else to describe this. The quality looks ok for a 40 dollar glove. The 16 oz one has a nice weight to it.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal P.

customer_reviews.title: Company sent me the wrong size
customer_reviews.text: But they arranged for an easy return process. Overall, the materials are durable. This brand used to be my favorite, but I feel like the quality has slightly decreased over the years.
customer_reviews.author: Elisabeth P.

customer_reviews.title: Well fitting and comfortable for play!
customer_reviews.text: Kids love them. Fit well for my son and daughter who are 8 years apart. Stitching looks like it will last. Kids say they are comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: TAMARA LUDINGTON

customer_reviews.title: They fall apart
customer_reviews.text: I'm actually super unhappy. These seemed to be great gloves, but two months in they're falling apart and the company said I have to talk to Amazon, and Amazon doesn't have a way to complain about it....so I'm here. DO NOT buy these.
customer_reviews.author: Zechariah M.

customer_reviews.title: Gloves seem like they're made quality and have great padding
customer_reviews.text: Gloves seem like they're made quality and have great padding. I personally, do not like them do to the size of the glove. My previous 16 oz., Torque, gloves fit perfectly. These gloves are more bulky along the wrist and creep up the forearm quite a bit. I'm 5'7 with a 30" reach, if that gives you a comparison. I will still use them as back up gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality
customer_reviews.text: By far the best boxing gloves you can use and buy, this brand is unmatched. Best quality there is in best comfort
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Gloves are great! I had a pair & used them for ...
customer_reviews.text: Gloves are great! I had a pair & used them for over a year! It is time for a new pair! I accidentally ordered a size way to big for me & cannot get in contact with the seller to exchange for a smaller size! In order to return the gloves I have to lose $10.00 of what I paid which makes no sense to me at all....which of course loosing money on an order doesn't make anyone happy.
customer_reviews.author: Shanyn

customer_reviews.title: Overall good cloves...but
customer_reviews.text: Gloves arrived quickly and this was my second pair. First ones were to big for me. This pair that I got I thought had packing material stuck up in the thumb. It actually was a dead brittle cockroach, not sure how they could solve. I cleaned it out and tried to get over it. Now I am okay. But not a great start.
customer_reviews.author: KAcord99

customer_reviews.title: Venum 12 ounce Challenger
customer_reviews.text: I've had these gloves for just over a year and a half, from beginner status to full on sparring now. When I really started sparring, I bought the Venum Elites, but I actually prefer my Challengers much more than the Elites. Both are great gloves, don't get me wrong, but I guess I just got attached to the Challenger gloves. Wouldn't trade these gloves for anything!
customer_reviews.author: Kat Bowen

customer_reviews.title: Just Don’t
customer_reviews.text: I love Venum but these gloves are not worth the price. I’ve owned 2 pair of these gloves within the last 2 years and the seams inside ripped open the same way and the padding started breaking down after the second month. I used them about 4-5 times a week for bag work and sparring. Unless you take a cardio kickboxing class twice a week don’t buy these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Maurice Graham

customer_reviews.title: comfortable and durable
customer_reviews.text: have been using them for a straight year and they are still holding up great! this 16oz model is great for those with bigger hands and in that respective weight class. comfortable when hitting the heavy bag, doing pad work and sparring. overall great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love love love these gloves. The color is perfect and it is durable. After washing the gloves, I do not see any wears and tears. I can punch the boxing bag or mitts without it impacting my knuckles. I will recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: rahi

customer_reviews.title: I have used them now for about two months and they are very comfortable and hold up very well
customer_reviews.text: Very well made gloves. A pair I had purchased from a different manufacturer began to rip at a seam. I purchased the Venum gloves as a replacement. I have used them now for about two months and they are very comfortable and hold up very well.
customer_reviews.author: Standmeupatthegatesofhell

customer_reviews.title: Excellent all-around glove
customer_reviews.text: An excellent all-around glove that lends itself handily to heavy bag work and sparring. The only knock I have on these gloves is that they can be a little snug once I have my hands fully wrapped. I also have mongoloid hands, so this might just be me. They were a little stuff at first but broke in nicely after About 4 training sessions. Now they are the just right cup of porridge for me :). They do have more padding than I am used to (traditional boxing gloves), as they are a Muay Thai style glove. I have enjoyed them very much and love hitting the bag with them.
customer_reviews.author: EkinnE

customer_reviews.title: Durable ,quality
customer_reviews.text: They look awesome , there comfortable and durable , I still have them there is only one tiny slit inside the glove other than that no tears .
customer_reviews.author: Gilberto Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: way better than my Everlast
customer_reviews.text: way better than my Everlast. The EVerlast broke in 2 months and customer service was unwilling to fix it. Venum have been holding strong for a while now and im happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Eli goodman

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Love these gloves! Only used them a few times so far but have held up well and protected my hands. I also recommend the venom wraps, they’ve been very comfortable as well. These gloves should be good for beginners or more advanced users, just make sure you pick a good weight based on your body size.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: I recommend👍😀👈
customer_reviews.text: I been boxing for 11 years these gloves are very comfortable and very good on impact for punching bag workouts i reccomend for beginners and definitely for experienced boxers
customer_reviews.author: Elena Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves, love them
customer_reviews.text: I have used these for a while now and I really like these gloves. They are very comfortable and easy to put on. The Velcro wraps around the wrist twice, making it easy to grab with a gloved hand and pull around. The end of the wrap doesn't have Velcro so it is easy to catch and pull them off. All and all great gloves, and I am glad I purchased them.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin London

customer_reviews.title: ... for my Muay Thai class and they have been great. The only downside is that they tend to ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these guys for over a year now for my Muay Thai class and they have been great. The only downside is that they tend to run a little big, but overall great quality and affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: DIYGUY

customer_reviews.title: Refreshing, just like the first day!
customer_reviews.text: Been a while since Ive dropped by the gym, due to my first pair wearing out! Hopefully these take a long time before theyre beat out like my first pair. Could only recommend these, and open grip strikes for ease-of-use for any beginner/trainee!
customer_reviews.author: Alphonsus

customer_reviews.title: Rating based on size and feel only - never used.
customer_reviews.text: Rating based on size and feel only. I purchased the 16 oz. and they were too small, and felt a little soft (for me - I'm 6'2", 230 lbs.) so I had to return. Ended up paying some more and getting another brand that carried an XL sizing with a better feel. But these could work well for another person.
customer_reviews.author: Kiki

customer_reviews.title: Know that the glove will be huge
customer_reviews.text: Only reason for the 4 stars is because of the size. The are just too big
customer_reviews.author: Guadalupe

customer_reviews.title: So far, no problems
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only been using these for 2 months but have no complaints at all! Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron A.

customer_reviews.title: Cloud boxing gloves
customer_reviews.text: Boxing gloves, it's difficult to find a good boxing glove and this has met my expectations. Great padding on the inside and outside with its weight distribute across the gloves. I've been using these glove for a month now which I use them 3 time a week and they are still holding up my heavy punches. I'll post another review in December to give you a better wear and tear report.
customer_reviews.author: Uly

customer_reviews.title: Consider useage
customer_reviews.text: I love Venum products, great padding and wrist support. But these gloves started to peel in multiple areas after 5-6 months of use. Used for sparing and pad work twice a week. The seller completely refunded me. I bought a better quality of Venum gloves. These are good for a beginner or light useage. Otherwise spend a little more money on a glove that is a step above these
customer_reviews.author: goofyfoot

product_meta.title: Venum Challenger 2.0 Boxing Gloves
product_meta.description:
Affordable but with no concession on the quality, "Challenger 2.0" gloves are handmade in Thailand and the perfect choice to begin to learn striking! 

Technical features:

 * 100% high quality PU
 * Breathable interior mesh
 * Triple density foam for a better shock management, and a top hand protection
 * 100% full attached Thumb
 * Embossed Venum Logo (3D touch) on each gloves
 * Large Velcro enclosure with elastic for a better adjustment
 * Hand Made in Thailand
feature_bullets: Breathable interior mesh , large velcro enclosure with elastic for a perfectly safe customized fit

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
